unnormalised: Okay, here's a Quora post about Air Quality, tailored as requested:
normalised: Subject: Air Quality - Is Delhi's Smog really getting better?

unnormalised: **Subject: Air Quality - Is Delhi's Smog *really* getting better?**
normalised: Hey everyone! So, air quality. We all breathe it (obviously!), but how many of us actually think about what we're inhaling? Especially us Delhiites, right?

unnormalised: Hey everyone! So, air quality. We all breathe it (obviously!), but how many of us actually *think* about what we're inhaling? Especially us Delhiites, right?
normalised: I swear, every Diwali (especially post two thousand and sixteen), it feels like we're living in a permanent fog. I remember vividly waking up on twenty eighth October two thousand and twenty three and not being able to see the building across the street! It's scary, and frankly, unhealthy. My nani complains about her breathing all the time – and she's lived in Delhi her whole life!

unnormalised: I swear, every Diwali (especially post 2016), it feels like we're living in a permanent fog. I remember vividly waking up on 28/10/2023 and not being able to see the building across the street! It's scary, and frankly, unhealthy. My nani complains about her breathing all the time – and she's lived in Delhi her whole life!
normalised: But, I've been seeing some reports claiming things are improving. Are they REALLY? Is all that talk about the odd-even scheme and shifting brick kilns outside a one hundred kilometer radius actually making a difference?

unnormalised: But, I've been seeing some reports claiming things are improving. Are they REALLY? Is all that talk about the odd-even scheme and shifting brick kilns outside a 100 km radius actually making a difference?
normalised: I've heard stories about I I T Delhi researchers working on some innovative filtration systems, and the government (both state and central) talks a big game about reducing emissions by twenty percent by two thousand and twenty five. But, are these promises just hot air? The A Q I still spikes horribly around zero nine hundred hours and seventeen hundred hours daily.

unnormalised: I've heard stories about IIT Delhi researchers working on some innovative filtration systems, and the government (both state and central) talks a big game about reducing emissions by 20% by 2025. But, are these promises just hot air? The AQI still spikes horribly around 09:00 hrs and 17:00 hrs daily.
normalised: I saw that the P M two point five levels were supposedly lower this year compared to five years ago on fifteenth August two thousand and twenty four, but I’m skeptical. Anyone have some real, on-the-ground experience to share? Are you noticing a change, or is it all just statistics trying to paint a rosy picture? Perhaps we need better enforcement of existing regulations. What do you all think? Maybe another Clean Air campaign like the one in Mumbai. Share your thoughts!

unnormalised: I saw that the PM2.5 levels were supposedly lower this year compared to 5 years ago on 15/08/2024, but I’m skeptical. Anyone have some real, on-the-ground experience to share? Are you noticing a change, or is it all just statistics trying to paint a rosy picture? Perhaps we need better enforcement of existing regulations. What do you all think? Maybe another Clean Air campaign like the one in Mumbai. Share your thoughts!
